intro: Raclathris, commonly known as the golden thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Raclathris species typically grow as shrubs or subshrubs, often forming dense stands in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
